questions.question_text: What is the purpose of enabling Windows Active Directory Domain Authentication on FortiAuthenticator?

choices.D: It enables FortiAuthenticator to register itself as a Windows trusted device to proxy authentication using Kerberos.
choices.C: It enables FortiAuthenticator to import users from Windows AD.
choices.A: It enables FortiAuthenticator to use Windows administrator credentials to perform an LDAP lookup for a user search.
choices.B: It enables FortiAuthenticator to use a Windows CA certificate when authenticating RADIUS users.

choices.D: Include the wireless client subnet range in the Exempt Source section.
choices.B: Enable the captive-portal-exempt option in the firewall policy with the ID 11.
choices.A: Disable the user group from the SSID configuration.
choices.C: Apply a guest.portal user group in the firewall policy with the ID 11.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I choose B because guest.portal user group may be defined after CP authentication
it was difficult to analize this part, but my logic says is C.

comments.content:
Scenario2:
When the SSID is not including any Exempt destinations (is empty), then the Answer is C, and on this case the image shows the SSID with this field empty, as a consequence all taks are done from the Firewall policy on guide page365 using the Source user group along with its services HTTP, HTTPS, at this point you DO NOT NEED to enable the Exempt from captive portal option inside the firewall policy, otherwise all traffic will be allowed and no captive portal will be presented. As a summary on this scenario C is the correct one.

Scenario 1:
Because on the SSID there is a field called Exempt destinations on Guide page 363 that must have a corresponding firewall policy in place, that firewall policy has ipv4 DST Addr pointing to the FortiAuthenticator (or any External server), It means if the SSID has the Excempt destination with one entry then the answer is B and you MUST enable the exempt from captive portal on the firewall policy in order to allow the traffic to the Destination server and Services like DNS, HTTP, HTTPS, ping.

study guide p. 363
Answer B Study Guide P363

Selected Answer: B
study guide page 363 - if using external captive portal configure policy and exempt web traffic to external captive portal

Selected Answer: C
Using B will ignore the portal entrance,The correct setting should be to set the source of ID11 policy to the Guest.portal Group

comments.content: Incorrect, The portal cannot be seen, we havent reached authentication yet, the portal address needs to be exempt, so it can be seen first. B is the Answer

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Examine the FortiGate configuration, FortiAnalyzer logs, and FortiGate widget shown in the exhibit.
An administrator is testing the Security Fabric quarantine automation. The administrator added FortiAnalyzer to the Security Fabric, and configured an automation stitch to automatically quarantine compromised devices. The test device (10.0.2.1) is connected to a managed FortiSwitch device.
After trying to access a malicious website from the test device, the administrator verifies that FortiAnalyzer has a log for the test connection. However, the device is not getting quarantined by FortiGate, as shown in the quarantine widget.
Which two scenarios are likely to cause this issue? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Change the AP 2.4 GHz channel to 11
choices.B: Change the AP 2.4 GHz channel to 1
choices.C: Change the AP 2.4 GHz channel to 9.
choices.D: Change the AP 2.4 GHz channel to 13.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.
//IMG//

//IMG//

Examine the troubleshooting outputs shown in the exhibits.
Users have been reporting issues with the speed of their wireless connection in a particular part of the wireless network. The interface that is having issues is the 2.4 GHz interface that is currently configured on channel 6.
The administrator of the wireless network has investigated and surveyed the local RF environment using the tools available at the AP and FortiGate.
Which configuration would improve the wireless connection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B correct as per study guide page 444

Selected Answer: B
for 2.4G, channel 1, 6 , 11 are working in a non-overlapping bundle. Assuming there is no change on channel on other areas, only channel 1 and 11 should be chose. In this case, since channel 1 has lower RSSI total and better RF-Score(higher) , So, I chose channel 1.

comments.content: For 2.4 use channel 1 , channel 6 or channel11 not channel 9 .

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Channel 9 utilization is only 1%, indicating that there is a significant amount of idle time on this channel.
